meanings.definition: The quality or state of being recoverable.
meanings.sent1: The recoverability of the lost data was crucial for the company's success.
meanings.sent2: Insurance policies often cover the recoverability of stolen items.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat had such amazing recoverability that it could bring back any object placed inside.
meanings.sent4: Her optimism had a recoverability that could always bounce back from setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The recoverability of the old book was surprising, considering its age.

meanings.definition: The ability to be regained or restored.
meanings.sent1: The recoverability of his health after the surgery was remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The recoverability of the antique vase after it fell was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power of recoverability made him invincible in battles.
meanings.sent4: The recoverability of the forest after the fire showed the resilience of nature.
meanings.sent5: The recoverability of the old car amazed everyone who thought it was beyond repair.
